text:
I'm going to be talking about the invention of TikTok. Originally called Musically, TikTok is an app on mobile devices that has known worldwide success in the past 3 years. This app can be used to post, edit and view content in a video format. It contains an algorithm that allows the users to watch videos suggested to them at all time and scroll continuously, constantly provided with new content. We can safely say that this social media has been a very important trend-setter, especially among the younger generation, as its number of users increased up to a billion over the last few years.
 In my opinion, like every big social media platform, it has negative and positive consequences. To me, TikTok has contributed to the expansion of the "influencer culture" originally initiated by its elder, Instagram. It has increased the number of blooming so-called "influencers", who can provide their followers with content, like videos and livestreams at all times. Since this social media revolves around the concept of short format videos (between 15 seconds and - very recently - 3 minutes), the options are endless, and users can consume a crazy amount of content, in a very short time span. Sometimes content-creators are likely to see their videos get thousands, sometimes millions of views over a few hours, which increases even more the production of content over time. It has become a never-ending cycle. To my mind, TikTok is the perfect example of this new era of digital consumerism.
